intro: Trimorpha strigosa, commonly known as the hairy trimorpha, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions in southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Trimorpha strigosa is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
